intro: Thibaudia breviflora, commonly known as the narrow-leaved thibaudia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces small, pale yellow to white flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats. Thibaudia breviflora is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
